chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: In the next part, we will talk about an important concept of HTML, i.e. forms.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: The work of forms is to collect data in real life and HTML.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: We have seen many such forms on different websites.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: I am showing you an example of Instagram.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Where I am given some options to type something,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: there is a place to type this password, then I have a button

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: with which I submit all the information to Instagram.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: In the same way, when we create an account on Instagram, Facebook or WhatsApp,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: we have to type our number first, then we get the OTP,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: and then we get the account.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: So whenever we go to a website or app as a new user,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: or whenever we log in, register, sign up, try to contact,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: then we see different forms on different websites.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: One or two examples of this can be like this.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: If I search on the internet,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: log in to Instagram.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: So in this way, after clicking on the first link,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: I will have a form display.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Here I can fill my phone number, username, email address,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: I will have a password here,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: I will have a username here.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Now there are different things in the forms that we notice.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: When we type the username, it is visible,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: but whenever we type the password, it is visible in the form of dot.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: So that no one can see our password when we type it.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: So in this way, there are many things in the form,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: which are small things in detail that matter.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: This login is a button in itself,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: after clicking it, an action is performed.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Now the action was performed,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: he checked the phone number, password is wrong,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: so we saw an error message.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: If I click on sign up,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: then for sign up, Instagram will give me a separate form,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: in which there will be an option for mobile number,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: there will be an option for full name, username, password.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: So in this way, this is a separate button for sign up.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Login with Facebook is a button in its app,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: if you click on it, then Facebook has its own separate form,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: which will open.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: So we see such forms on many different websites,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: and all these forms,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: we can recreate with the help of HTML forms.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: First of all, we are going to talk about its syntax in the forms.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Like we use the table tag to make tables,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: in the same way, to make forms in HTML,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: we are using this form tag.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: All the content of the form,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: that I have to take text,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: I have to take the input of the number,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: I have to make a button,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: all the things come under this form tag.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: So if I write a form in my HTML,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: then I will have a form created,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: but because that form will be empty now,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: nothing will be displayed on my screen.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Like I have made a classroom.html file,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: in this, in the body tag,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: I am going to make a form tag.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Let's save this,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: and if I open and refresh this file,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: then now my whole page is empty,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: because I have made a form,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: but now there is no content in this form.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: So slowly we will read about

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: different contents, elements,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: and attributes of the form.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: The first thing about which we are going to read

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: in the forms is my action attribute.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: What is the function of the action attribute?

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: In the form tag,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: I can define my action attribute.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: And its function is that

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: it tells what action should be performed

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: after submitting the form.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: The function of the form is

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: to take a lot of data input from the user,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: but what to do with this data?

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Once all the data is submitted,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: then where should I send this data?

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: This is what my action attribute tells me.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: So action gives me an address

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: that all the data of the form

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: should be sent to this address.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Or send it to this address.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: If we look at its definition,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: then action attribute is used to define

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: what action needs to be performed

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: when a form is submitted.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: For example, if we submit a form,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: then we click the login button.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: If we submit a form,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: then we click the register button.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: When we submit the final form,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: then where should we send all the data?

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Or what action should be performed?

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: This is what my action attribute tells me.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Usually, where does this action attribute

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: get redirected?

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Either to a JavaScript file or

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: to another file that will

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: perform some work with that data.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: For example, here I have written

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: action.php file.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: So an example is that I have created

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: a PHP file named action.php

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: which will perform some action with

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: the data of this form.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Or I can redirect it to any sub-URL.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: For example, if I write slash action,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: then my browser will search

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: the file slash action and try to send

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: all the data there.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: For now, we can write anything in action,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: but later on, how actions are performed

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: with this data, where it is sent,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: how it works in the file,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: we will understand all these things in detail

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: while reading JavaScript.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: For now,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: I will create an action attribute

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: in my form stack.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: I will write it as slash server.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Or instead of slash server,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: for now, we will write it as slash action.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: Let's save this.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: But my form will not be created yet.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: My entire web page will be empty

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: because there is no content

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: in the form.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: When we talk about content in the form,

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: we usually talk about buttons

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: or input text.

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: So, the first thing we will read

chunks.title: Forms in HTML
chunks.text: in terms of form element is my input element.

text: In the next part, we will talk about an important concept of HTML, i.e. forms. The work of forms is to collect data in real life and HTML. We have seen many such forms on different websites. I am showing you an example of Instagram. Where I am given some options to type something, there is a place to type this password, then I have a button with which I submit all the information to Instagram. In the same way, when we create an account on Instagram, Facebook or WhatsApp, we have to type our number first, then we get the OTP, and then we get the account. So whenever we go to a website or app as a new user, or whenever we log in, register, sign up, try to contact, then we see different forms on different websites. One or two examples of this can be like this. If I search on the internet, log in to Instagram. So in this way, after clicking on the first link, I will have a form display. Here I can fill my phone number, username, email address, I will have a password here, I will have a username here. Now there are different things in the forms that we notice. When we type the username, it is visible, but whenever we type the password, it is visible in the form of dot. So that no one can see our password when we type it. So in this way, there are many things in the form, which are small things in detail that matter. This login is a button in itself, after clicking it, an action is performed. Now the action was performed, he checked the phone number, password is wrong, so we saw an error message. If I click on sign up, then for sign up, Instagram will give me a separate form, in which there will be an option for mobile number, there will be an option for full name, username, password. So in this way, this is a separate button for sign up. Login with Facebook is a button in its app, if you click on it, then Facebook has its own separate form, which will open. So we see such forms on many different websites, and all these forms, we can recreate with the help of HTML forms. First of all, we are going to talk about its syntax in the forms. Like we use the table tag to make tables, in the same way, to make forms in HTML, we are using this form tag. All the content of the form, that I have to take text, I have to take the input of the number, I have to make a button, all the things come under this form tag. So if I write a form in my HTML, then I will have a form created, but because that form will be empty now, nothing will be displayed on my screen. Like I have made a classroom.html file, in this, in the body tag, I am going to make a form tag. Let's save this, and if I open and refresh this file, then now my whole page is empty, because I have made a form, but now there is no content in this form. So slowly we will read about different contents, elements, and attributes of the form. The first thing about which we are going to read in the forms is my action attribute. What is the function of the action attribute? In the form tag, I can define my action attribute. And its function is that it tells what action should be performed after submitting the form. The function of the form is to take a lot of data input from the user, but what to do with this data? Once all the data is submitted, then where should I send this data? This is what my action attribute tells me. So action gives me an address that all the data of the form should be sent to this address. Or send it to this address. If we look at its definition, then action attribute is used to define what action needs to be performed when a form is submitted. For example, if we submit a form, then we click the login button. If we submit a form, then we click the register button. When we submit the final form, then where should we send all the data? Or what action should be performed? This is what my action attribute tells me. Usually, where does this action attribute get redirected? Either to a JavaScript file or to another file that will perform some work with that data. For example, here I have written action.php file. So an example is that I have created a PHP file named action.php which will perform some action with the data of this form. Or I can redirect it to any sub-URL. For example, if I write slash action, then my browser will search the file slash action and try to send all the data there. For now, we can write anything in action, but later on, how actions are performed with this data, where it is sent, how it works in the file, we will understand all these things in detail while reading JavaScript. For now, I will create an action attribute in my form stack. I will write it as slash server. Or instead of slash server, for now, we will write it as slash action. Let's save this. But my form will not be created yet. My entire web page will be empty because there is no content in the form. When we talk about content in the form, we usually talk about buttons or input text. So, the first thing we will read in terms of form element is my input element.
